what: Compute Information Length for Qualitative Traits — inflen.qual
title: Compute Information Length for Qualitative Traits — inflen.qual
text: function inflen.qual computes length information code can indicate possession descriptor state qualitative trait (Wallace Boulton 1968; Balakrishnan Suresh 2001; Balakrishnan Suresh 2001; Balakrishnan Nair 2003)   .

title: Compute Information Length for Qualitative Traits — inflen.qual
Compute Information Length for Qualitative Traits — inflen.qual
text: x Data qualitative trait accessions collection vector type factor. freq absolute frequencies descriptor states qualitative trait x subset accessions. adj logical. TRUE, proportion estimates slightly biased include zero frequency descriptor states computation (See Details). Default TRUE.

title: Compute Information Length for Qualitative Traits — inflen.qual
text: data frame 2 columns: x qualitative   trait data inflen Information length computed

title: Compute Information Length for Qualitative Traits — inflen.qual
text: qualitative trait/descriptor \(d\) probability occurrence descriptor state \(m\) subset \(t\) estimated \[p_{m,d,t} = \frac{n_{m,d,t} + 1}{n_{d,t} + M_{d}}\] , \(n_{m,d,t}\) number accessions \(m\) state trait \(d\) subset \(t\), \(n_{d,t}\) number accessions known state trait \(d\) subset \(t\),.e. number accessions subset \(t\) \(M_{d}\) number descriptor states trait \(d\). slightly biased estimate include zero frequency descriptor states computation. actual estimate \[p_{m,d,t} = \frac{n_{m,d,t}}{n_{d,t}}\] Now length information code can optimally indicate possession descriptor state \(m\) trait \(d\) subset \(t\) computed \[c_{m,d,t} = -\ln p_{m,d,t}\]

title: Compute Information Length for Qualitative Traits — inflen.qual
text: Balakrishnan R, Nair NV (2003). “Strategies developing core collections sugarcane (Saccharum officinarum L.) germplasm-comparison sampling diversity groups constituted three different methods.” Plant Genetic Resources Newsletter, 33–41. Balakrishnan R, Suresh KK (2001). “Strategies developing core collections safflower (Carthamus tinctorius L.) germplasm-part II. Using information measure obtaining core sample pre-determined diversity levels several descriptors simultaneously.” Indian Journal Plant Genetic Resources, 14(1), 32–42. Balakrishnan R, Suresh KK (2001). “Strategies developing core collections safflower (Carthamus tinctorius L.) germplasm-part III. Obtaining diversity groups based information measure.” Indian Journal Plant Genetic Resources, 14(3), 342–349. Wallace CS, Boulton DM (1968). “information measure classification.” Computer Journal, 11(2), 185–194.

title: Compute Information Length for Qualitative Traits — inflen.qual
code: suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(EvaluateCore))  library(EvaluateCore)  # Get data from EvaluateCore  data("cassava_EC", package = "EvaluateCore")  # Data of 'Colour of unexpanded apical leaves' qualitative trait CUAL <- as.factor(cassava_EC$CUAL)  # Get frequencies based on sample size prop <-  prop.adj(CUAL, method = "sqrt") size.prop <- 0.2 size.count <- ceiling(size.prop * length(CUAL)) CUALfreq <- round(prop * size.count)  # Compute information length CUALinflen <- inflen.qual(x = CUAL, freq = CUALfreq, adj = TRUE)  head(CUALinflen) #>             x   inflen #> 1  Dark green 1.452784 #> 2 Light green 2.400824 #> 3  Dark green 1.452784 #> 4  Dark green 1.452784 #> 5  Dark green 1.452784 #> 6  Dark green 1.452784

what: Compute Information Length for Quantitative Traits — inflen.quant
title: Compute Information Length for Quantitative Traits — inflen.quant
text: function inflen.quant computes length information code can indicate possession specific value quantitative trait (Wallace Boulton 1968; Balakrishnan Suresh 2001; Balakrishnan Suresh 2001; Balakrishnan Nair 2003)   .

title: Compute Information Length for Quantitative Traits — inflen.quant
Compute Information Length for Quantitative Traits — inflen.quant
text: x Data quantitative trait accessions collection numeric vector. mean target mean. sd target standard deviation e Th least count measurement quantitative trait.

title: Compute Information Length for Quantitative Traits — inflen.quant
text: data frame 2 columns: x quantitative   trait data inflen Information length computed

title: Compute Information Length for Quantitative Traits — inflen.quant
text: quantitative trait \(d\), assumed normally distributed within subset \(t\) mean \(\mu_{d,t}\) standard deviation \(\sigma_{d,t}\) estimated . \[\mu_{d,t} = \frac{\sum x_{d,s}}{n_{d,t}}\] \[\sigma_{d,t} = \sqrt{\frac{\sum(x_{d,s} - \mu_{d,t})^2}{n_{d,t} - 1}}\] , distribution normalizing constant \(g_{d,t}\) can estimated \[g_{d,t} = \ln \left ( \frac{\sigma_{d,t}}{K \cdot \varepsilon_{d}} \right )\] \(K = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2\Pi}}\), \(\varepsilon_{d}\) least count measurement descriptor \(d\). .e. \(x\) measured accuracy \(\pm\varepsilon_{d}\). probability getting measurement \(x\) distribution mean \(\mu\) variance \(\sigma\) approximately follows. \[K \cdot \frac{\varepsilon_{d}}{\sigma_{d,t}} \cdot e^{\frac{-(x_{d,s} - \mu_{d,t})^2}{2 \sigma_{d,t}^{2}}}\] Now length information code can optimally indicate possession value \(x\) trait \(d\) computed follows: \[c_{x,d,t} = g_{d,t} + \frac{(x_{d,s} - \mu_{d,t})^2}{2 \sigma_{d,t}^{2}}\]

title: Compute Information Length for Quantitative Traits — inflen.quant
text: Balakrishnan R, Nair NV (2003). “Strategies developing core collections sugarcane (Saccharum officinarum L.) germplasm-comparison sampling diversity groups constituted three different methods.” Plant Genetic Resources Newsletter, 33–41. Balakrishnan R, Suresh KK (2001). “Strategies developing core collections safflower (Carthamus tinctorius L.) germplasm-part II. Using information measure obtaining core sample pre-determined diversity levels several descriptors simultaneously.” Indian Journal Plant Genetic Resources, 14(1), 32–42. Balakrishnan R, Suresh KK (2001). “Strategies developing core collections safflower (Carthamus tinctorius L.) germplasm-part III. Obtaining diversity groups based information measure.” Indian Journal Plant Genetic Resources, 14(3), 342–349. Wallace CS, Boulton DM (1968). “information measure classification.” Computer Journal, 11(2), 185–194.

title: Compute Information Length for Quantitative Traits — inflen.quant
code: suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(EvaluateCore))  library(EvaluateCore)  # Get data from EvaluateCore  data("cassava_EC", package = "EvaluateCore")  # Data of 'Average plant weight' quantitative trait AVPW <- cassava_EC$AVPW  # Compute information length AVPWinflen <- inflen.quant(x = AVPW, mean = 4, sd = 3.25, e = 1)  head(AVPWinflen) #>           x   inflen #> 1 3.0000000 2.144931 #> 2 2.5000000 2.204102 #> 3 0.4000000 2.711085 #> 4 0.3333333 2.734017 #> 5 7.5000000 2.677475 #> 6 5.6000000 2.218777

title: Relative Frequency Adjustments — prop.adj
text: Compute transform relative frequencies accessions qualitative trait following methods (Balakrishnan Suresh 2001) : Square root-proportion Log-frequency

title: Relative Frequency Adjustments — prop.adj
Relative Frequency Adjustments — prop.adj
text: x Data qualitative trait accessions collection vector type factor. method method transformation. Either "none" transformation "log" log-frequency transformation "sqrt" square root-proportion transformation.

title: Relative Frequency Adjustments — prop.adj
text: relative frequencies named numeric vector.

title: Relative Frequency Adjustments — prop.adj
text: \(p_{}\) relative frequency \(\)th descriptive state qualitative trait collection, square root-proportion transformed relative \(q_{}\) computed \[q_{} = \frac{\sqrt{p_{}}}{\sum_{=1}^{s}\sqrt{p_{}}}\] \(s\) number possible descriptor states qualitative trait collection. Similarly, log-frequency transformed relative \(q_{}\) computed \[q_{} = \frac{\log{F_{}}}{\sum_{=1}^{s}\log{F_{}}}\] \(F_{}\) absolute frequency \(\)th descriptive state qualitative trait collection.

title: Relative Frequency Adjustments — prop.adj
text: Balakrishnan R, Suresh KK (2001). “Strategies developing core collections safflower (Carthamus tinctorius L.) germplasm-part II. Using information measure obtaining core sample pre-determined diversity levels several descriptors simultaneously.” Indian Journal Plant Genetic Resources, 14(1), 32–42.

title: Relative Frequency Adjustments — prop.adj
code: suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(EvaluateCore))  library(EvaluateCore)  # Get data from EvaluateCore  data("cassava_EC", package = "EvaluateCore")  # Data of 'Colour of unexpanded apical leaves' qualitative trait CUAL <- as.factor(cassava_EC$CUAL)  # Raw relative frequencies prop.adj(CUAL, method = "none") #>   Dark green        Green Green purple  Light green       Purple  #>  0.190617577  0.001187648  0.527909739  0.028503563  0.251781473   # Square root-proportion transformed relative frequencies prop.adj(CUAL, method = "sqrt") #>   Dark green        Green Green purple  Light green       Purple  #>   0.23369439   0.01844636   0.38890779   0.09036836   0.26858311   # Square log-frequency transformed relative frequencies prop.adj(CUAL, method = "log") #>   Dark green        Green Green purple  Light green       Purple  #>   0.24903071   0.02990846   0.29298449   0.16703765   0.26103869
